00e3cba3-aead-4d04-b60e-bcacaa162175.description: The LEADERSHIP BADGE validates that the earner has demonstrated the ability to leverage the strengths of others to achieve common goals and use interpersonal skills to coach and develop others. The individual is able to use empathetic skills to guide and motivate, and to organize, prioritize, and delegate work.
00e3cba3-aead-4d04-b60e-bcacaa162175.name: Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: In order to obtain the Leadership Badge, a student must obtain a score of at least 15 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above.

1db0424a-1568-4c32-91f2-2a1b2bad81b2.description: The Interculturalist badge validates that the earner values, respects, and learns from diverse cultures, races, ages, genders, sexual orientations, and religions. The individual demonstrates openness, inclusiveness, sensitivity, and the ability to interact respectfully with all people and understand individuals’ differences.
1db0424a-1568-4c32-91f2-2a1b2bad81b2.name: Interculturalist

badge_template_activities.title: To receive the badge, students will score at least 21 out of 28 points based on their digital storytelling project completed during or after taking ANTH 201 (Introduction to Sociocultural Anthropology). The digital story is based on their participant observation project.

60adf941-72a0-467d-81ec-ea054cf65114.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated the ability to leverage the strengths of others to achieve common goals and use interpersonal skills to coach and develop others. The individual is able to use empathetic skills to guide and motivate, and to organize, prioritize, and delegate work. In order to obtain the iLead Leadership Badge, a student must obtain a score of at least 15 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above.
60adf941-72a0-467d-81ec-ea054cf65114.name: Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a score of at least 15 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above.

a6ad98d6-1a64-48a4-b8c7-bb96e51ec33b.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated the ability to articulate thoughts and ideas clearly and effectively in written, oral and interpersonal forms. The individual is able to obtain, interpret, and use knowledge, facts, and data in this process, and should demonstrate originality and creativity. In order to obtain the Macklin Business Institute Communicator Badge, a student must obtain a score of at least 16 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above.
a6ad98d6-1a64-48a4-b8c7-bb96e51ec33b.name: Communicator

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a score of at least 16 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above.

247a2562-2d39-4bf2-a94d-6264cfc42760.description: This microcredential covers competencies in the areas of: Empathy (How do you try to understand others' feelings through their frame of reference?), Self-Education (What knowledge do you need to act as an advocate for social justice?), Self-Awareness (Look within to manifest a non-judgmental view of who you are in terms of compassion for others, biases, and an action plan towards more inclusionary practices.), and Advocate (How can you apply social justice to your own community?)
247a2562-2d39-4bf2-a94d-6264cfc42760.name: Social Justice

badge_template_activities.title: In order to obtain the Social Justice Badge, a student must obtain a score of at least 8 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above.

0a54d8dc-dc90-4d60-901a-a2076dad7654.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated the ability to leverage the strengths of others to achieve common goals by effectively assessing individual and collective capacities, engaging diverse and competing perspectives, and articulating a vision and strategy. The individual is able to use empathetic and reflection skills to guide and motivate, and to organize, prioritize, and delegate work.
0a54d8dc-dc90-4d60-901a-a2076dad7654.name: Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a score of at least 24 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above

4da7ec67-db22-494d-aab0-66b2f8401412.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated the ability to leverage the strengths of others to achieve common goals and use interpersonal skills to coach and develop others. The individual is able to use empathetic skills to guide and motivate, and to organize, prioritize, and delegate work. In order to obtain the Macklin Business Institute Leadership Badge, a student must obtain a score of at least 19 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above.
4da7ec67-db22-494d-aab0-66b2f8401412.name: Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a score of at least 19 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above.

ec730fed-acc6-4d02-9c00-64eb260a8918.description: This badge validates the work of students who persist in their educational and career goals, particularly in their successful transfer to a 4-year institution. The badge recognizes the competencies of organizational navigation, adaptability, resilience, and initiative, which are valued by employers and necessary for students to take the steps that will assure a successful transition to a 4-year institution, where they will continue the completion of an undergraduate degree.
ec730fed-acc6-4d02-9c00-64eb260a8918.name: Commitment

badge_template_activities.title: In order to obtain the Commitment Badge, a student must obtain a score of at least 8 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above.

7539eac4-73b8-412e-b6d9-69f563de96a7.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated the knowledge, skills, and abilities that form the foundation for success as an entrepreneur ready to launch a new venture or an intrapreneur who will bring these competencies to a future employer. The individual can identify and clearly define a business opportunity and its value proposition; is solutions-oriented; and demonstrates an ability to articulate a concept or idea and persuade a target group to join, invest, buy, or take other action.
7539eac4-73b8-412e-b6d9-69f563de96a7.name: Entrepreneur

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a score of at least 12 points with all dimensions rated at competent or above.

f2eba672-2ea9-40ca-bd3e-60af4e805438.description: The Changemaker Badge recognizes the work of students who are engaged in social and environmental justice learning and actions that align with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. The competencies align with Ashoka U’s changemaker competencies as well as those of the 21st Century Workplace Skills. This badge validates that the earner has demonstrated competencies that are valued by employers and other stakeholders who are critical to a student’s success.
f2eba672-2ea9-40ca-bd3e-60af4e805438.name: Changemaker

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be evaluated on a rubric that aligns with successful completion of a series of assignments, experiences, and service projects. Using the attached rubric, students will be assessed using a point value and any student who meets or exceeds basic competency and earns a score of between 10 and 12 will be eligible to receive the Changemaker Badge.

d9506a9b-b030-497f-bfbe-14215160174a.description: The Teaching Essentials: Innovation and Transformation Badge validates learning pedagogical and instructional attitudes and knowledge of techniques and skills to promote student success. It is an optional and additional path for faculty to enhance teaching skills by participating in the Academy for Teaching.
d9506a9b-b030-497f-bfbe-14215160174a.name: Teaching Essentials: Innovation and Transformation

badge_template_activities.title: In order to obtain the Teaching Essentials: Innovation and Transformation Badge, faculty must demonstrate a level of competent or above in all 5 dimensions.

4be2f14f-080c-458b-bc04-2bfbfb1a6587.description: The Problem Solver Badge validates that the earner has demonstrated the skills necessary to resolve complex problems/challenges by exercising sound reasoning to analyze issues, make decisions, and overcome challenges. The individual is able to obtain, interpret, and use knowledge, facts, and data in this process, and should demonstrate originality and inventiveness.
4be2f14f-080c-458b-bc04-2bfbfb1a6587.name: Problem Solver

badge_template_activities.title: To receive the badge, earners will score at least 12 out of 18 points, with all dimensions rated at competent or above.

4eec6f4c-141c-4331-aa0c-b52906952d04.description: The ANTIRACIST BADGE validates that the earner demonstrates the following competencies: Self-Awareness – What is your role in racism? Self-Education - What knowledge do you need to act as an antiracist? Action - How can you practice antiracism? Definition: Actively contribute to antiracist and equitable practices that influence individual and systemic change through advocacy and education.
4eec6f4c-141c-4331-aa0c-b52906952d04.name: Antiracist

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must be competent in all three areas to earn the badge.

a41cc34f-031e-4ebf-879b-bd9e413b7323.description: The badge validates that the earner has demonstrated the ability to articulate innovative thoughts and ideas clearly and effectively in written and oral forms.
a41cc34f-031e-4ebf-879b-bd9e413b7323.name: Creative Writing

badge_template_activities.title: Students should earn ten or more Competent or Accomplished levels for each category.

e4a59e50-807b-404a-a133-c44c5547123f.description: The badge validates that earners have demonstrated the ability to logically connect ideas, scrutinize and evaluate arguments, find inconsistencies and errors in work, solve complex problems, and engage in reflection.
e4a59e50-807b-404a-a133-c44c5547123f.name: Critical Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: Students should earn ten or more Competent or Accomplished levels for each category.

skills.name: Apply Critical Thinking And Structured Analytical Techniques

5a1cf422-4277-4fce-b351-cc76f61d7bd1.description: Culture Conscious Business badge validates that earners have demonstrated the competencies needed to navigate the complexities of diversity and differences in modern organizations based on one’s level of cultural competence within the following model of competencies, activities, and assessments.
5a1cf422-4277-4fce-b351-cc76f61d7bd1.name: Culture Conscious Business

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete all assessments and activities at a satisfactory or above level to receive this badge.

b0eeec49-e85c-4d54-8cf8-dc6cc86846ce.description: The Ethics Problem Solver Badge validates that the earner is competent to resolve complex problems/challenges by exercising sound reasoning and ethical judgment to analyze issues, make decisions, and overcome challenges.
b0eeec49-e85c-4d54-8cf8-dc6cc86846ce.name: Ethics Problem Solver

badge_template_activities.title: To receive the badge, earners will score at least 12 out of 18 points, with all dimensions rated at competent or above.

940ff3b0-cc85-4042-acaf-e271b5e9a127.description: The FUNDRAISING BADGE validates that the earner has demonstrated the ability to lead and manage others in fundraising strategy. The individual can work with others to achieve a common fundraising goal, communicate essential ideas and concepts effectively, and maintain a degree of professionalism and ethical standards while being strategic and persistent in achieving their individual and team goals.
940ff3b0-cc85-4042-acaf-e271b5e9a127.name: Fundraising

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must rate competent or above in all six dimensions.

6dc015b1-a78e-43bd-92da-ac99c213a306.description: This badge validates that the earner has demonstrated the ability to leverage OER, including defining elements and considering using existing or creating OER; understanding copyright and selecting appropriate creative commons licensing; using critical thinking and information literacy skills to locate and evaluate high-quality OER, and knowledge of open pedagogy and the benefits of renewable assignments.
6dc015b1-a78e-43bd-92da-ac99c213a306.name: OER Advocate

badge_template_activities.title: To obtain the OER Advocate Badge, a faculty member must obtain a score of at least 12 points with all dimensions rated competent or above.

8088b927-d222-495f-8573-edf3753b82bb.description: The earner of this badge becomes eligible to teach online or blended courses for Montgomery College by designing an online or blended course and building a course prototype consisting of a syllabus, orientation, and one learning module. The prototype is refined until it serves as a model and a set of page templates for building the rest of the course.
8088b927-d222-495f-8573-edf3753b82bb.name: Online Teaching

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully create an online or blended learning course prototype

1ff21953-e5d8-4509-970a-9c6c3db5ad3a.description: This badge validates that the earner has demonstrated the competencies necessary for inclusive quality course design and delivery in a virtual (online or remote) learning environment.
1ff21953-e5d8-4509-970a-9c6c3db5ad3a.name: Quality Assurance Design and Delivery

badge_template_activities.title: The earner must demonstrate the ability to establish instructor presence, recognize and align requisite career or learning pathways, develop a course plan/syllabus to represent course structure, identify and reinforce student learning gaps, and target students’ needs to achieve course outcomes.

62bf582c-cfa8-4510-b960-5a2b4b18dcc2.description: This badge validates that the earner has demonstrated the competencies necessary for inclusive quality course transformation in a virtual (online or remote) learning environment.
62bf582c-cfa8-4510-b960-5a2b4b18dcc2.name: Quality Assurance Transformer

badge_template_activities.title: The ability to enhance online presence, encourage active learning in alignment with requisite career or learning pathways, influence progress through an inclusive course structure to minimize student learning gaps, and anticipate student learning needs to achieve course outcomes. Prerequisites: Successful completion of QA Design and Delivery Badge with 80% or more at the accomplished level or equivalent training/design/delivery experience.
